page.title: 02ARTS AND CRAFTS - SULLINGTON
page.content: Examples of Art and Craft in Sullington are to be found in the Parish Church. One tapestry worked by local people commemorates the marriage of the Prince and Princess of Wales. Another, in memory of a former verger who was a carpenter, was embroidered by his daughter. Washington Church houses a memorial in the form of a carved table in memory of those killed in the Second World War 1939-1945. There are also some remarkable hand-embroidered curtains of uncertain origin hanging in the Abbey in Greyfriars Lane, and carvings in what is now the Chapel include a bust of Elizabeth I.
